importantDates.descriptionOfWhyDateIsRelevant: This is the date when Netflix announced the new Kennedy family series, marking a significant development in entertainment related to U.S. political history.

importantTimeframes.descriptionOfWhyTimeFrameIsRelevant: The series spans from the 1930s to 1956, tracing the early life and rise of the Kennedy family, a pivotal period in American political history.

keyTakeAways: Netflix has announced a new drama series titled 'Kennedy' based on Fredrik Logevall’s biography 'JFK: Coming of Age in the American Century, 1917–1956'.
The series stars Michael Fassbender as Joe Kennedy, Sr., and explores the triumphs and tragedies of the Kennedy family.
The show begins in the 1930s and follows the rise of Joe and Rose Kennedy and their nine children, including Jack, who struggles to escape the shadow of his older brother.
The series is described as a blend of American mythology and human storytelling, offering insights into both the Kennedy family and broader American history.
The show is not to be confused with Ryan Murphy's upcoming 'American Love Story' focusing on JFK Jr.
The series is set to run for eight episodes and does not yet have a release date.
The Kennedy family's legacy — including political achievements and tragic losses — is central to the narrative and relevance of the series.

namedEntities.name: Netflix
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: Netflix is the entity producing and announcing the new Kennedy series, making it central to the announcement and distribution of the show.

namedEntities.name: Michael Fassbender
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: He is cast as Joe Kennedy, Sr., the patriarch of the Kennedy family, bringing significant star power and credibility to the series.

namedEntities.name: Kennedy family
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: The Kennedy family is the central subject of the series, with their political legacy and personal tragedies forming the core narrative.

namedEntities.name: Joe Kennedy, Sr.
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: Father of John F. Kennedy; patriarch of the Kennedy family
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: He is the central character portrayed by Michael Fassbender, representing the origin of the family's political ascent.

namedEntities.name: Rose Kennedy
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: Joe Kennedy’s wife; mother of the Kennedy children
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: She is part of the family dynamic that shapes the lives of the Kennedy children and their journey toward political prominence.

namedEntities.name: John F. Kennedy
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: 35th U.S. President and son of Joe Kennedy, Sr.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: He is a key figure in the Kennedy legacy, symbolizing both the political success and the tragic end of the dynasty.

namedEntities.name: Fredrik Logevall
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: Author of the book 'JFK: Coming of Age in the American Century, 1917–1956'
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: His biography serves as the source material for the series, lending historical credibility and depth to the narrative.

namedEntities.name: Sam Shaw
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: He is responsible for the creative direction and narrative structure of the series, emphasizing its thematic depth and historical insight.

namedEntities.name: Ryan Murphy
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: Producer of a different series on JFK Jr.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: His upcoming show is contrasted with the new Netflix series to avoid confusion and clarify the focus of each production.

namedEntities.name: JFK Jr.
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: Son of John F. Kennedy; a presidential hopeful
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: His death in a plane crash in 1999 is referenced as part of the Kennedy family's tragic legacy.

summaryOfNewsArticle: Netflix has unveiled a new drama series titled 'Kennedy,' based on Fredrik Logevall’s biography, which tells the story of the rise and struggles of the Kennedy family from the 1930s to 1956. The series stars Michael Fassbender as Joe Kennedy, Sr., and explores the personal and political dynamics of the family, including the complex relationship between Jack and his older brother. The narrative blends American political mythology with intimate family struggles, offering insight into both the Kennedys and broader historical currents. The show is distinct from Ryan Murphy’s upcoming series on JFK Jr. and will run for eight episodes, though a release date has not been announced.
title: Netflix announces new Kennedy family series starring Michael Fassbender
